prompt: Photorealistic macro shot focusing on the bases of three different antique glass bottles (aqua medicine, amber beer, clear soda) arranged horizontally on a weathered dark wood surface. Sharp focus highlights the intricate embossed maker's marks, lettering, and numbers on each base. Subtle imperfections like wear marks, seed bubbles, and slight iridescence are visible. Soft, directional studio lighting from the side casts gentle shadows, emphasizing the relief of the embossing and the texture of the glass. Shallow depth of field softly blurs the wood grain in the foreground and background. Professional, high-detail photography style. --ar 16:9 --style raw
name: old-glass-bottles-identification-image-1.png

prompt: Informative photorealistic comparison shot focusing on the neck and lip finish of two distinct 19th-century glass bottles side-by-side against a neutral, lightly textured grey backdrop. One bottle features a crudely applied lip, the other a more refined tooled lip. Sharp focus clearly shows the vertical mold seams running up the neck and how they terminate differently below each lip type. Details include slight glass impurities, whittle marks, and the texture difference between the bottle body and the lip finish. Clean, bright, diffused lighting from the front-left illuminates the glass structure without harsh reflections. Documentary style, high resolution. Composition places bottles slightly left of center in the 16:9 frame. --ar 16:9 --style raw
name: old-glass-bottles-identification-image-2.png

prompt: Atmospheric photorealistic still life of a diverse collection of 8-10 antique glass bottles arranged aesthetically across a rustic wooden shelf. Features various shapes (apothecary, soda, ink, whiskey, poison) and colors (cobalt blue, deep amber, olive green, aqua, clear). Some bottles have partial aged paper labels or prominent side embossing. Warm, natural window light streams from the right side, illuminating the glass, highlighting translucency, and casting long soft shadows. Dust motes visible in the light beam. Background is softly blurred, suggesting a collector's study. Rich textures, warm tones, nostalgic feel. Wide landscape composition filling the 16:9 frame. --ar 16:9 --style raw
name: old-glass-bottles-identification-image-3.png

prompt: Gritty photorealistic scene depicting hands in worn leather gloves carefully excavating several old glass bottles from dark, damp earth, possibly near old stone foundations partially visible in the background. Bottles (aqua, dark olive green 'black glass') are partially unearthed, covered in patches of dirt. Focus is on the moment of discovery, highlighting the textures of soil, glass, and gloves. Low-angle natural light, perhaps late afternoon sun filtering through foliage, creates dramatic highlights and shadows. Documentary style capturing the context of bottle digging. Composition uses a low angle looking slightly down, with hands and bottles central in the 16:9 frame. --ar 16:9 --style raw
name: old-glass-bottles-identification-image-4.png

prompt: Extreme close-up, technical photorealistic macro shot focusing on the base of a single, antique aqua glass medicine bottle with a distinct, jagged pontil scar. A vintage metal-rimmed magnifying glass is positioned over the scar, enlarging the rough texture, trapped bubbles (seeds), and characteristic imperfections of the hand-finished base. The hand holding the magnifying glass is partially visible on the right. Bright, focused lighting illuminates the area under magnification, creating sharp details and reflections on the glass surface. Background is a simple, out-of-focus light-colored textured surface like linen. Shallow depth of field isolates the pontil detail. Horizontal 16:9 composition with the subject slightly off-center. --ar 16:9 --style raw
name: old-glass-bottles-identification-image-5.png
